Main component.description: The component named Main is the one that get's rendered on the screen.

Store.description: Stores are global containers of application specific data.

Store property.description: The property keyword when used in a store defines part of the data that the store contains.

Functions.description: Functions can be defined on modules, components, stores and providers.

Next Call.description: Functions can be defined on modules, components, stores and providers.

Render.description: The render function renders the component into an HTML tree.

HTML Elements.description: HTML elements can be written as in standard HTML.

Span Element.description: HTML elements can be written as in standard HTML.

Paragraph Element.description: HTML elements can be written as in standard HTML.

Title Element.description: HTML elements can be written as in standard HTML.

Button Element.description: HTML elements can be written as in standard HTML.

HTML Expressions.description: HTML Expressions allows inserting data into HTML elements or components.

Attributes.description: Attributes are either strings or expressions.

Modules.description: Modules are kind of containers for a set of relatable functions, usually used to gather functions that relate to a specific type.

Components.description: Components are reusable pieces of code that have specific behavior, styles and content.

Components Tags.description: Tags that have the name of a component will render that component at the point where the tag is defined.

Events.description: All event handlers are functions, they take an event record and return Void.

Connect.description: The connect directive lets you connect a component to a store which allows you to call the stores functions and properties without using the stores name.

Style.description: Styles define with CSS how an HTML element looks.

Computed Properties.description: Computed properties works like regular properties but instead of returning a constant value it can return different values base on the state and the properties.

If.description: The if...else conditional expression can return two different values based on a condition.

Case.description: A case expression is useful for matching enums or exact values, while also supporting a default value.

Record.description: Records are object like data structures, that have a fix set of keys and values.

Try.description: try is a control expression for handling synchronous computations that might fail, for example when you are trying to convert an untyped JavaScript object into a typed Record.

Do.description: do expressions are for two things: handling asynchronous computations that might fail, for example when loading something with a request, or executing asynchronous expressions sequentially.

Routes.description: In Mint routes of an application are defined at the top level with the routes block.
